content: for the mi cid 425 en flap round 3 knit round 4 knit round 5 *k1 p1* repeat round 5 for a total of 6 6 8 rounds bind off in pa cid 425 ern tip be sure to count your rounds so you know how many rounds to knit for the 2nd mi cid 425 en © jacqueline henderson www youtube com/@jacqknits 3 | page flip top with new working yarn and using the long tail cast on cast on 17 18 19 s cid 415 tches on two dpns using the third dpn pick up 17 18 19 s cid 415 tches along the purl edge of your mi cid 425 en picking up the bobble cid 425 om loop of the purl bump be sure your mi cid 425 en is with the top of the mi cid 425 en facing up or away from you now join in the round and knit one complete round round 1 see photos below - 34 36 38 sts round 2 *k1 p1* repeat repeat round 2 for total of 6 6 8 rounds round 3 knit repeat round 3 for 10 10 12 rounds or un cid 415 l piece reaches just past the end of your pinky finger when tried on with the flip top closed © jacqueline henderson www youtube com/@jacqknits 4 | page flip top decreases round 1 k2tog k to 3 sts before end of 2nd dpn ssk k1 k2tog k to 3 sts to end of 3rd dpn ssk k1 4 st decrease round 2 knit all repeat rnds 1 and 2 two two three more cid 415 mes repeat round 1 three three three more cid 415 mes you should now have 10 12 10 s cid 415 tches total break yarn with darning needle thread yarn and draw through remaining s cid 415 tches pull cid 415 ght to close push needle through hole to inside secure by threading again through last few s cid 415 tches weave in end thumb put 5 sts from co edge inside of thumb onto 1 dpn divide held sts between two other dpns with new working yarn start round beginning with co sts join in the round - 16 16 18 s cid 415 tches round 1 knit all sts in the round repeat round 1 for a total of 6 8 9 rounds or un cid 415 l it almost reaches your thumb knuckle note on the first round knit the first 5 sts through the back loop to correctly orientate the s cid 415 tches for future rounds round 2 *k1 p1* repeat round 2 for a total of 4 4 6 rounds or un cid 415 l thumb reaches just past your knuckle tip be sure to count your rounds so you know how many rounds to knit for the 2nd mi cid 425 en bind off in pa cid 425 ern when weaving in ends take the tail from the start
